Text: E-Excuse me... My goods... Monsters...

(I thought we just had to contact the merchants
transporting the tree...but it seems I was wrong.)
Are you okay?! Let me treat you!
Urgh... Thank you...so much...

You mentioned something about monsters, but can you
explain in more detail?
It was...an accident... The tree fell...suddenly...
The monster cage...I was carrying... It broke...
Huh...?! Why do you have monsters...

Probably just for show. Some noble families and royal
family members have that kind of bad taste...

(In any case, there will be monsters on the loose
near where the accident happened.)

We need to take down those monsters. Otherwise we
can't get our tree.
But that means...the event would be cancelled...!

The committee, Rose, and the merchants all worked so
hard. Cid and the other students are counting on us,
too!
Pooch...

(No, it isn't just Pooch... At this rate, Sherry's
hard work and drive will all be for naught, too!)
Alexia! I-I...!

Yes, let's beat the monsters and get those goods
back!
Where did the accident occur? We'll head to the scene!

M-My apologies... The beasts were in a forest near
town—
*huff, huff*

By the time they reach the scene of the fallen tree,
the sun is almost set.
Wow, so many...

Yeah, so many decorations. They really, really
stand out...

At the site of the accident, there are wagons that
have been destroyed or overturned by the fallen
tree, and ornaments are scattered all around.
Rrrrrr.... Grrrr!

Seems like a monster was also injured in the
accident. Looks like it's keeping still and trying
to recover.

They say a wounded beast is more dangerous. We need
to keep our guard up...

(Sherry is shaking. It's natural to be scared when
facing a horde of monsters.)
Sherry, do you have any battle experience?

Almost nothing at all... But if it's got anything to
do with artifacts, that's different...!

Then can I ask you for combat support? I'll stay up
front.
I've got your back!

(I don't actually have much combat experience, but I
can fight better than she can.)

(I don't match up to my sister Iris...but I still
have my sword!)
Are you ready, Sherry? Let's do it!
In front! Two o'clock!
Take this!
Gwoaaarrr!!!
Three coming at 10 o'clock!
I see them!
Gwoaaarrr!!!

(There's a lot of them, but they aren't that strong!
I could almost handle this on my—)
Agh! My eyes...!

(Damn, blood splashed right in my eyes! This is not
good...!)
Alexia!
Grrr, rar...!

Once her vision clears, Alexia sees that a third
monster has been felled with a stone.
Yay, I got it!
Wow, Sherry! Nicely aimed!

Just keep throwing like that! Even if you miss a weak
spot, it will divert and confuse them!
Y-Yes!

(I could recover thanks to Sherry! The two of us can
do this!)
Rrrr, grah!!

These monsters were caught and desperately want to
live, but so do we!

Really? I thought you might be a type of softy who
feels sorry for monsters.
Maybe before, but―!

(A small bird that was raised in a cage is about to
be released to fly free...)

(Looking at Sherry now, I am sure she feels that
way.)
Look! In the back!

Th-That certainly is a big one... Oh? Could that tree
down there be the one we ordered?!
Brrrr!! Pwweee!!
Is that their boss?
How to say this... It'scuter than I expected...

Don't be fooled by its appearance! These types of
monsters move in packs, like bees following their
queen!
Too long! Short version, please!
Defeating the boss will end the fight!
Got it! Let's go!

Alexia and Sherry leap toward the boss. To save their
tree, and to save the event.
